Chapter.Heading: Families of Polytopes

ManSection.Description: Returns the rank n+1 polytope; the tiling of E^n by n-cubes.
Constructs the internally self-dual polyhedron of type {p, p} described in Theorem 5.3 of . #( https://doi.org/10.11575/cdm.v12i2.62785). p must be at least 7.
Constructs the internally self-dual polyhedron of type {p, p} described in Theorem 5.8 of .# ( https://doi.org/10.11575/cdm.v12i2.62785). p must be even and at least 6, and k must be odd.

polyhedron is the flat orientably regular polyhedron with automorphism group [p, q] / (r2 r1 r0 r1 = (r0 r1)^i (r1 r2)^j). This function validates the inputs to make sure that the polyhedron is well-defined. Use FlatOrientablyRegularPolyhedronNC if you do not want this validation.
Returns a list of all flat, orientably regular polyhedra with Schlafli symbol sym.
Returns a list of all tight, orientably regular polytopes with Schlafli symbol sym. When sym has length 2, this just calls FlatOrientablyRegularPolyhedraOfType(sym).

Section.Heading: Toroids

ManSection.Description: Returns the toroidal map \{4,4\}_{\vec u, \vec v}. If only u is given, then v is taken to be u rotated 90 degrees, in which case the resulting map is either reflexible or chiral.
Given IsInt triple s, k, n, will return the regular toroid \{4, 3^{n-2},4\}_{\vec s} where \vec s=(s^k, 0^{n-k}).

Given an integer n and a list of vectors vecs, returns the cubic toroid that is a quotient of CubicTiling(n) by the translation subgroup generated by the given vectors. The results may be nonsensical if vecs does not generate an n-dimensional translation group.
Given IsInt pair s, k, will return the regular toroid \{3,3,4,3\}_{\vec s} where \vec s=(s^k, 0^{n-k}). Note that k must be 0 or 1.
Given IsInt pair s, k, will return the regular toroid \{3,4,3,3\}_{\vec s} where \vec s=(s^k, 0^{n-k}). Note that k must be 0 or 1.

Chapter.Section:
Uniform polyhedra
Representations of the uniform polyhedra here are from .
maniplex
Constructs the cuboctahedron.
gap> SchlafliSymbol(Cuboctahedron()); [ [ 3, 4 ], 4 ]
maniplex
Constructs the truncated tetrahedron.
gap> SchlafliSymbol(TruncatedTetrahedron()); [ [ 3, 6 ], 3 ]
maniplex
Constructs the truncated octahedron.
gap> Fvector(TruncatedOctahedron()); [ 24, 36, 14 ]
maniplex
Constructs the truncated octahedron.
gap> Fvector(TruncatedCube()); [ 24, 36, 14 ] gap> SchlafliSymbol(TruncatedCube()); [ [ 3, 8 ], 3 ]
maniplex
Constructs the icosadodecahedron.
gap> VertexFigure(Icosadodecahedron()); Pgon(4) gap> Facets(Icosadodecahedron()); [ Pgon(5), Pgon(3) ]
maniplex
Constructs the truncated icosahedron.
gap> Facets(TruncatedIcosahedron()); [ Pgon(6), Pgon(5) ]
maniplex
Constructs the small rhombicuboctahedron.
gap> ZigzagVector(SmallRhombicuboctahedron()); [ 12, 8 ]
maniplex
Constructs the pseudorhombicuboctahedron.
gap> Size(ConnectionGroup(Pseudorhombicuboctahedron())); 16072626615091200
maniplex
Constructs the snub cube.
gap> IsEquivelar(PetrieDual(SnubCube())); true gap> SchlafliSymbol(PetrieDual(SnubCube())); [ 30, 5 ] gap> Size(ConnectionGroup(PetrieDual(SnubCube()))); 3804202857922560 gap> Size(AutomorphismGroup(PetrieDual(SnubCube()))); 24
maniplex
Constructs the small rhombicosidodecahedron.
gap> Facets(SmallRhombicosidodecahedron()); [ Pgon(5), Pgon(4), Pgon(3) ]
maniplex
Constructs the great rhombicosidodecahedron.
gap> Facets(GreatRhombicosidodecahedron()); [ Pgon(10), Pgon(4), Pgon(6) ]
maniplex
Constructs the small snub dodecahedron.
gap> Facets(SnubDodecahedron()); [ Pgon(5), Pgon(3) ] gap> IsEquivelar(PetrieDual(SnubDodecahedron())); true
maniplex
Constructs the truncated dodecahedron.
maniplex
Constructs the great rhombicuboctahedron.
